feed.title: Review: Age of Empires Online
feed.subtitle: "Age of Empires Online" takes the classic game and expands it to include both a social and MMORPG aspect.

link.Abstract: "Age of Empires Online" takes the classic game and expands it to include both a social and MMORPG aspect.
link.title: Age of Empires Online

category.term: 317~Age of Empires~Gas Powered Games Corp.~Microsoft Corporation
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Platform: PC (Free to Play or $19.99 for Premium Pack)

The "Age of Empires" franchise has delighted real-time strategy fans for nearly 15 years, thanks to its tremendous depth and flawless multiplayer experience. As impatient gamers gnawed at their fingernails in eager anticipation of a new "Age of Empires" title, Gas Powered Games and Microsoft Studios were preparing to not only deliver but shock the very foundation of their loyal community. The latest title to grace personal computers everywhere would not be an enhancement to earlier versions but a reimagining that would be given away for free.

"Age of Empires Online" takes the classic game and expands it to include both a social and MMORPG aspect. Gamers will not only sculpt their civilizations using the Greek or Egyptian empires, but they will continue to thrive whether they're playing or not. Your cities will continue to gather resources and expand while other players can visit to purchase needed items or check your progress. Once you sign back in, you'll have the opportunity to engage in quests, do battle with other civilizations or even join up with friends to accomplish more difficult tasks. As you finish these events, your city will begin to gain levels, which will ultimately result in new perks for your people.

While the free version offers hours of gameplay and a fun online experience, the premium pack takes things to a whole new level. For just under 20 bucks, you'll be given access to rare gear, the full tech tree, new player-versus-player options and crafting halls. Aside from these game-changing perks, premium players will also receive additional inventory slots, workshops and the ability to earn in-game cash from their stores.

When it comes to competitive games that offer free and pay services, balance becomes an issue. Gas Powered Games has managed to resolve this by forcing the premium players to earn their upgrades as opposed to automatically starting with them. This should even the playing field for most and keep things as fair and complaint-free as possible.

When fans wait patiently for the latest edition of their favorite title, they can become a bit fearful and judgmental. While "Age of Empires Online" may make some worry due to its cartoonish looks and overall departure from the original series, it more than makes up for it with new features, a deep and perpetual world, and most importantly, the extremely low price tag.
